title: Question 25
prompt:
Nuclear energy is an example of a nonrenewable resource because nuclear power requires uranium that must be mined from the earth and is not quickly replenished. Wind, however, is just moving air created by the heat from the sun and therefore is a renewable resource. A renewable resource becomes non-renewable when it is consumed faster than nature can replace it.

Which of the following is also an example of a nonrenewable resource?
feedback: Nonrenewable resources are resources that do not renew themselves at a rate that keeps up with human consumption. Coal, natural gas, and petroleum are examples of nonrenewable resources. Timber is considered a renewable resource even though demand for lumber is a primary cause of deforestation.
